Specific Details: Proposal for residential and recreational development.
DPOs Lobbied: Tom Brabazon|Councillor|Dublin City Council::Declan Flanagan|Councillor|Dublin City Council::Alison Gilliland|Councillor|Dublin City Council::John Lyons|Councillor|Dublin City Council::Mícheál MacDonncha|Councillor|Dublin City Council::Michael O'Brien|Councillor|Dublin City Council::Larry O'Toole|Councillor|Dublin City Council::Edel Moran|Councillor|Dublin City Council
Subject Matter: Proposal for residential and recreational development.
Intended Results: To provide public representatives with information about a proposal to provide housing and recreation amenities on the site of the former Chiver's factory, Coolock.::Support for the property to be transformed from light industrial to residential and recreational land use.
Lobbying Activities: Each email included a letter providing an overview of the draft plan for the site as well as a copy of the Masterplan, which was prepared as part of a pre-planning submission to Dublin City Council.|Email|6-10::Each letter sent was a hard copy equivalent of the letter sent by email, as well as a colour hard copy of the Masterplan.|Letter|6-10::A walking tour of the Chivers' site was provided to two members of the local community and a local public representative.|Meeting|1::Each local public representative for the local area was telephoned to enquire if they wished to visit the Chivers' site and discuss the housing plans as proposed.|Phone call|6-10
Client(s): Platinum Land Limited|8 Queripel House, 1 Duke of York Square, London SW3 4LY, United Kingdom|info@platinum-land.com|+44 7702 745222
